citation.article-title: Filimonas lacunae gen. nov., sp. nov., a member of the phylum Bacteroidetes isolated from fresh water.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Filimonas (Fi.li.mo′nas. L. n. filum a thread; Gr. fem. n. monas a unit, a monad; N.L. fem. n. Filimonas a thread-like monad).
Cells are Gram-negative, strictly aerobic, non-spore-forming, non-flagellated, gliding and filamentous.
Flexirubin-type pigments are not formed and nitrate is not reduced.
Negative for hydrolysis of chitin and cellulose.
The major fatty acids are 15 : 0 iso, 17 : 0 iso 3-OH and 15 : 1 iso G.
The major respiratory quinone is MK-7.
Positioned phylogenetically in the phylum Bacteroidetes.
The type species is Filimonas lacunae.
